meanings.definition: A radioactive metallic chemical element with the symbol Cf and atomic number 98.
meanings.sent1: Scientists study californium to learn about radioactive elements.
meanings.sent2: The lab used californium to conduct experiments on nuclear reactions.
meanings.sent3: When the californium spilled, the lab mice glowed in the dark!
meanings.sent4: Her love for chemistry was as rare and powerful as californium.
meanings.sent5: The bright glow of californium illuminated the entire room.

meanings.definition: A synthetic element produced in nuclear reactors.
meanings.sent1: Nuclear engineers work with californium to create new elements.
meanings.sent2: The production of californium requires advanced technology.
meanings.sent3: The californium in the reactor decided to throw a party for the other elements.
meanings.sent4: The impact of his words was as potent as californium in a nuclear reaction.
meanings.sent5: The hum of the reactor filled the room as californium was synthesized.
